concept_data.title: Territorial Collectivity of Saint Pierre and Miquelon

summary: The "Territorial Collectivity of Saint Pierre and Miquelon" refers to a French overseas territory, categorized under 7241 overseas countries and territories in EU legal frameworks. This collectivité territoriale plays a significant role in fisheries, particularly concerning species such as clupea harengus (herrings) and mytilus edulis (mussels). Regulatory measures, including those from the ministère, address the mechanisation of fishing practices and the sustainable management of marine resources, including homarus americanus (lobsters) and placopecten magellanicus (scallops). The region's unique status necessitates specific legal provisions, ensuring the singleness of its governance while facilitating trade and economic activities, including the procurement of seafood products.
